title: AI-Enhanced Runtime Debugger Visualizer
subtitle: An interactive simulation of an AI agent assisting in debugging via the Debug Adapter Protocol (DAP).
usage.title: How to Use This Simulator
usage.intro: This application simulates how an AI agent can automate debugging steps. Follow these instructions:
usage.step1: The Code Panel on the left contains sample Python code. You can edit this code to create your own scenario.
usage.step2: Select an AI Model from the dropdown at the top right. The 'Mock Agent' is useful for quick, key-free demonstrations.
usage.step3: Press the Start Simulation button. This will ask the selected AI to analyze your code and generate a step-by-step execution trace.
usage.step4: The simulation will pause at the first executable line, highlighted in the Code Panel.
usage.step5: The State Panel shows the call stack and variables. The AI Prompt Configuration panel lets you customize the instructions sent to the AI.
usage.step6: The AI Agent Panel shows the 'Golden Context' prompt sent to the AI model.
usage.step7: Press the AI Decide Next Step button. The AI agent will analyze the context and decide the next debugging action (e.g., 'stepOver').
usage.step8: The simulation advances, and all panels update. The AI's decision is shown in its panel. Continue pressing the button to step through the program.
aiModel.selector.label: AI Model:
promptConfig.title: AI Prompt Configuration
promptConfig.systemPrompt.label: System Prompt
promptConfig.systemPrompt.tooltip: The core instruction given to the AI agent to define its role and goal.
promptConfig.codeContext.label: Code Context Window
promptConfig.codeContext.tooltip: The number of lines of code to show the AI before and after the current breakpoint line.

dap.initial: Log will appear here once the simulation starts.
ai.title: AI Agent

ai.contextInitial: Context will be generated when a step is taken.
ai.error.title: An Error Occurred
error.simulation.generationFailed: Simulation could not be generated from the provided code.
error.simulation.unknown: An unknown error occurred while generating the simulation.
error.ai.unknown: An unknown error occurred with the AI agent.
arch.title: Proposed Architectures
arch.description: Two primary patterns for integrating an AI agent with a DAP-based debugger.
arch.patternA.title: Pattern A: IDE Extension
arch.patternB.title: Pattern B: Intermediary Service
arch.patternA.desc: The AI Agent is a plugin directly within the IDE, intercepting DAP traffic between the IDE's UI and the debug adapter.
arch.patternB.desc: The AI Agent is a separate server that acts as a proxy between the IDE (thin client) and the debug adapter.
roadmap.title: Project Vision & Roadmap
roadmap.item1.title: Core Concept: AI-Driven Debugging
roadmap.item1.desc: Prove that an LLM can make logical debugging decisions based on DAP state.
roadmap.item2.title: DAP Simulation
roadmap.item2.desc: Simulate the flow of DAP messages for a realistic debugging session.
roadmap.item3.title: Context Engineering
roadmap.item3.desc: Develop a pipeline to transform raw DAP JSON into a concise, effective 'golden context' for the LLM.
roadmap.item5.title: Dynamic Simulation Generation
roadmap.item5.desc: Use an LLM to generate simulation traces from user-provided code.
roadmap.item6.title: Functional VS Code Plugin (Pattern A)
roadmap.item6.desc: Implement the core logic in a background-service architecture that mirrors a real VS Code extension.
roadmap.item7.title: Production Refactor (Pattern B)
roadmap.item7.desc: Decouple the agent logic into a standalone server, making the IDE extension a thin client.
roadmap.item8.title: Autonomous CI/CD Agent
roadmap.item8.desc: Enable an AI agent to connect to the Pattern B server to debug and fix unit test failures without human intervention.
footer.builtWith: An Augur Project. Built with React and Tailwind CSS.
footer.disclaimer: This is a conceptual demonstration and not a production-ready tool.
